title: Isaiah Chapter 35 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Isaiah chapter 35 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Isaiah Chapter 35 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Isaiah Chapter 35.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 35:1, what will the desert do?
options: Rejoice and blossom as the rose
questions.correctAnswer: Rejoice and blossom as the rose
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:1 states that the desert shall rejoice and blossom as the rose.

questions.question: What will the wilderness and solitary place do according to Isaiah 35:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Be glad
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:1 says the wilderness and solitary place shall be glad.

questions.question: Isaiah 35:3 instructs to strengthen what?
options: The weak hands and feeble knees
The strong arms and firm feet
The wise minds and brave hearts
questions.correctAnswer: The weak hands and feeble knees
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:3 commands to strengthen the weak hands and confirm the feeble knees.

questions.question: In Isaiah 35:4, what are those with fearful hearts told?
questions.correctAnswer: Be strong, fear not
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:4 tells those with fearful hearts to be strong and not to fear.

questions.question: What will happen to the eyes of the blind according to Isaiah 35:5?
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be opened
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:5 states that the eyes of the blind shall be opened.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 35:6, what will the lame man do?
questions.correctAnswer: Leap as a hart
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:6 says the lame man shall leap as a hart.

questions.question: What will break out in the wilderness according to Isaiah 35:6?
questions.correctAnswer: Waters
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:6 mentions that waters shall break out in the wilderness.

questions.question: Isaiah 35:7 describes the parched ground becoming what?
questions.correctAnswer: A pool
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:7 states that the parched ground shall become a pool.

questions.question: What is the name of the highway mentioned in Isaiah 35:8?
questions.correctAnswer: The way of holiness
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:8 says the highway shall be called The way of holiness.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 35:9, who shall walk on the highway of holiness?
questions.correctAnswer: The redeemed
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:9 states that the redeemed shall walk there and no lion or ravenous beast shall be found.

questions.question: Who will return to Zion with songs and everlasting joy according to Isaiah 35:10?
questions.correctAnswer: The ransomed of the LORD
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:10 describes the ransomed of the LORD returning to Zion with songs and everlasting joy.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 35:4 says that God will come with vengeance and save His people.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:4 states that God will come with vengeance and save His people.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 35:9 states that lions and ravenous beasts will roam the way of holiness.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:9 says no lion or ravenous beast shall be found on the way of holiness.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 35:7 says that the thirsty land will remain dry and barren.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:7 says the thirsty land shall become springs of water.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Isaiah 35:10: 'And the ransomed of the LORD shall return, and come to Zion with songs and everlasting _______ upon their heads.'
questions.correctAnswer: joy
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:10 mentions everlasting joy upon their heads.

medium.title: Isaiah Chapter 35 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Isaiah Chapter 35 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a trial and asks you for counsel. Based on Isaiah 35, what biblical truth would you share about trusting God in difficult times?
options: God will come to save and strengthen those who fear Him
They must rely solely on their own strength to overcome
Trials are a sign that God has abandoned them
They should ignore their fears and pretend everything is fine
questions.correctAnswer: God will come to save and strengthen those who fear Him
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:3-4 encourages strengthening weak hands and feeble knees and says God will come with vengeance and recompense to save those who fear Him. This shows God’s faithfulness in trials.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 35 teach us about the importance of encouragement in the Christian community?
options: We should strengthen the weak and confirm the feeble
We should only focus on those who are strong in faith
Encouragement is unnecessary because faith is personal
We should avoid those who struggle spiritually
questions.correctAnswer: We should strengthen the weak and confirm the feeble
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:3 commands believers to strengthen weak hands and confirm feeble knees, highlighting the biblical virtue of mutual encouragement and support within the community.

questions.question: A believer is fearful about their future. According to Isaiah 35, what should you tell them about God’s character?
options: God will come to save and vindicate His people
God will leave them to face troubles alone
God is indifferent to human fears
God only helps those who are perfect
questions.correctAnswer: God will come to save and vindicate His people
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:4 encourages those with fearful hearts to be strong and not fear, because God will come with vengeance and recompense to save them, showing His protective and saving nature.

questions.question: How does the promise of healing in Isaiah 35:5-6 encourage believers to persevere through physical and spiritual hardships?
options: God will open the eyes of the blind and unstopp the ears of the deaf
Healing is not promised and suffering is permanent
Believers must earn healing through works
Suffering shows God’s displeasure and will not end
questions.correctAnswer: God will open the eyes of the blind and unstopp the ears of the deaf
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:5-6 depicts God’s miraculous healing, encouraging believers to trust God’s power to restore both physical and spiritual brokenness, fostering perseverance.

questions.question: In the context of Isaiah 35, what does the imagery of the 'wilderness blossoming' teach us about spiritual renewal and hope?
options: God can transform desolate lives into places of beauty and joy
Spiritual dryness is permanent and cannot be changed
Only certain people can experience renewal
Renewal comes only through human effort
questions.correctAnswer: God can transform desolate lives into places of beauty and joy
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:1-2 shows the wilderness and desert rejoicing and blossoming, symbolizing God’s power to bring spiritual renewal and abundant joy to those who trust Him.

questions.question: What practical lesson about holiness and walking with God can be drawn from Isaiah 35:8?
options: The way of holiness is a protected path where the unclean cannot pass
Holiness is optional and everyone can enter the same way
Sinful habits have no effect on spiritual direction
The path to God is confusing and uncertain
questions.correctAnswer: The way of holiness is a protected path where the unclean cannot pass
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:8 describes a highway called the way of holiness where the unclean do not pass, teaching that holiness protects and guides believers on the right path.

questions.question: A believer asks how Isaiah 35 encourages perseverance in the face of spiritual danger. What biblical truth would you share?
options: No lion or ravenous beast shall be found on the way of holiness
Spiritual dangers are unavoidable and always lead to failure
Believers must fight alone against spiritual enemies
questions.correctAnswer: No lion or ravenous beast shall be found on the way of holiness
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:9 promises that no dangerous beasts will be found on the way of holiness, symbolizing God’s protection for the redeemed, encouraging perseverance in holiness.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 35:10's depiction of the ransomed returning with joy inspire a believer’s attitude towards trials and suffering?
options: Joy and gladness will replace sorrow and sighing for those redeemed by God
Trials mean God has rejected His people
Joy is only for those without trials
questions.correctAnswer: Joy and gladness will replace sorrow and sighing for those redeemed by God
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:10 promises that the ransomed of the Lord will return with everlasting joy and sorrow will flee, encouraging believers to endure trials with hope.

questions.question: True or False: According to Isaiah 35:7, God’s provision can turn even the driest and most barren places into places of refreshment and life.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:7 speaks of parched ground becoming pools and thirsty land springs of water, signifying God's power to provide refreshment and life in barren situations.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 35:6 teaches that those who cannot physically leap or sing are excluded from God’s blessings.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:6 uses the imagery of the lame leaping and the dumb singing to symbolize restoration and joy, not exclusion; all who trust God are included in His blessings.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Isaiah 35:4 teaches us to tell those who are of a fearful heart, 'Be strong, fear not: behold, your God will come with _____.'
questions.correctAnswer: vengeance
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:4 specifically says God will come with vengeance and recompense, encouraging believers to be strong and fearless.

questions.question: How can Isaiah 35:2's description of rejoicing and singing influence a believer’s approach to worship and gratitude?
options: Believers are encouraged to express abundant joy and singing because of God’s glory
Worship should be quiet and solemn without joy
Gratitude is unnecessary since God’s glory is distant
Singing is only for professional worship leaders
questions.correctAnswer: Believers are encouraged to express abundant joy and singing because of God’s glory
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:2 speaks of rejoicing with joy and singing because of seeing the glory of the Lord, encouraging believers to worship with joyful gratitude.

questions.question: What does Isaiah 35:10 suggest about the future hope for believers and its effect on their daily lives?
options: Believers will experience everlasting joy and sorrow will flee
Believers should not hope for joy in this life
Sorrow will always dominate believers’ lives
questions.correctAnswer: Believers will experience everlasting joy and sorrow will flee
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:10 promises that the ransomed will return with everlasting joy and sorrow will flee, encouraging believers to live with hope and joy daily.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 35:8 highlight the importance of holiness in a believer’s walk with God?
options: The way of holiness is a distinct path where the unclean cannot enter, guiding believers safely
Holiness is optional and has no real effect on spiritual journey
Everyone can walk any path regardless of holiness
Holiness is a private matter with no community impact
questions.correctAnswer: The way of holiness is a distinct path where the unclean cannot enter, guiding believers safely
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:8 describes the way of holiness as a protected highway where the unclean cannot pass, teaching the vital role of holiness in spiritual safety and direction.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 35:9, what assurance is given to the redeemed about their spiritual journey?
options: No dangerous beasts will be found on their path
They will face constant danger and fear
Their journey will be lonely and unprotected
They must rely on their own strength to survive
questions.correctAnswer: No dangerous beasts will be found on their path
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:9 assures that no lion or ravenous beast will be found on the way of holiness, symbolizing God’s protection for the redeemed.

hard.title: Isaiah Chapter 35 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Isaiah Chapter 35.

questions.question: In Isaiah 35:1, the wilderness and desert are described as blossoming. Which Old Testament theme does this imagery primarily evoke?
options: The return from exile in Ezra
The promise of the Messiah in Isaiah 7
questions.correctAnswer: Creation renewal as in Genesis 1
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:1 uses blossoming desert imagery that recalls the creation motif of renewal and life emerging from barren places, paralleling Genesis 1's theme of God bringing order and life from chaos.

questions.question: Isaiah 35:4 commands to 'Be strong, fear not' because God will come with vengeance. Which New Testament passage echoes this reassurance of God's saving presence?
options: John 14:27 - Jesus gives peace and commands not to fear
Romans 8:31 - God is for us, who can be against us?
Revelation 19:11 - Christ comes as a warrior on a white horse
Philippians 4:13 - Strength through Christ who empowers
questions.correctAnswer: Revelation 19:11 - Christ comes as a warrior on a white horse
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:4's promise that God will come with vengeance and recompense foreshadows the apocalyptic return of Christ as a conquering king in Revelation 19:11.

questions.question: The phrase 'the eyes of the blind shall be opened' in Isaiah 35:5 is a typology often associated with which New Testament miracle of Jesus?
options: Healing the man born blind in John 9
questions.correctAnswer: Healing the man born blind in John 9
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:5's prophecy about opening the eyes of the blind is typologically fulfilled in Jesus healing the man born blind in John 9, symbolizing spiritual as well as physical sight.

questions.question: Isaiah 35:6 mentions a 'lame man leap as an hart.' What literary device is primarily used in this verse to convey restoration?
questions.correctAnswer: Simile
questions.explanation: The phrase 'leap as a hart' in Isaiah 35:6 is a simile comparing the restored lame man's leaping to the graceful leap of a deer, emphasizing joyful restoration.

questions.question: Isaiah 35:7 describes 'the habitation of dragons' becoming grassy. What is the Hebrew word often translated as 'dragons' here, and what does it signify?
options: Tannin, meaning sea monsters or serpents
Leviathan, meaning a chaotic sea creature
Rahab, a symbol of Egypt or chaos
questions.correctAnswer: Tannin, meaning sea monsters or serpents
questions.explanation: The Hebrew word 'tannin' in Isaiah 35:7 is often translated as dragons or sea monsters, symbolizing chaotic or desolate places being transformed into life-giving habitats.

questions.question: The 'way of holiness' mentioned in Isaiah 35:8 can be interpreted as an allusion to which ancient Israelite concept?
options: The sacred path to the Tabernacle or Temple
The route of the Exodus wilderness journey
The prophetic call for social justice
The path of the Law given at Sinai
questions.correctAnswer: The sacred path to the Tabernacle or Temple
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:8's 'way of holiness' likely alludes to the sacred approach to the Tabernacle or Temple, a path reserved for the pure and set apart from the unclean.

questions.question: Isaiah 35:9 states that 'no lion shall be there.' What does this symbolize in the context of the chapter's theme?
options: The removal of danger and fear
A test of faith for the redeemed
questions.correctAnswer: The removal of danger and fear
questions.explanation: The absence of lions in Isaiah 35:9 symbolizes the elimination of threats and dangers, fitting the chapter’s theme of restoration and safety in God's redeemed realm.

questions.question: Isaiah 35:10 speaks of 'the ransomed of the LORD' returning with everlasting joy. Which Psalm similarly celebrates the joy of redemption and return?
questions.correctAnswer: Psalm 126
questions.explanation: Psalm 126 celebrates the joy of the returned exiles, paralleling Isaiah 35:10’s theme of the redeemed returning with joy and gladness.

questions.question: The exhortation in Isaiah 35:3 to 'strengthen ye the weak hands' employs what kind of rhetorical device common in Hebrew poetry?
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:3 uses synonymous parallelism, repeating the idea of strengthening weakness in hands and knees to emphasize encouragement.

questions.question: The transformation of the parched ground into pools in Isaiah 35:7 foreshadows which New Testament theme?
options: Living water offered by Jesus in John 4
The baptism of Jesus in the Jordan
The outpouring of the Holy Spirit at Pentecost
questions.correctAnswer: Living water offered by Jesus in John 4
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:7’s imagery of water breaking out in the desert foreshadows Jesus’ offer of living water to the Samaritan woman in John 4, symbolizing spiritual renewal.

questions.question: Which ancient Near Eastern cultural context helps explain the significance of the 'glory of Lebanon' and 'excellency of Carmel and Sharon' in Isaiah 35:2?
options: These regions were known for their fertility and majestic forests
They were centers of pagan worship and idolatry
They were desert wastelands with no vegetation
They were major political capitals of Assyria
questions.correctAnswer: These regions were known for their fertility and majestic forests
questions.explanation: Lebanon, Carmel, and Sharon were renowned for their lush forests and fertile lands, so referencing their glory in Isaiah 35:2 symbolizes abundant blessing and restoration.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 35:8 states that even fools who are wayfaring men will err on the way of holiness.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:8 says that the way of holiness is so sure that even fools who are wayfaring men will not err therein, emphasizing the clarity and safety of God's path.

questions.question: The phrase 'sorrow and sighing shall flee away' at the end of Isaiah 35:10 serves as what kind of literary device?
questions.correctAnswer: Personification
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:10 personifies sorrow and sighing as fleeing away, vividly portraying the complete removal of suffering in the redeemed state.

questions.question: Isaiah 35:6 mentions 'the tongue of the dumb sing.' In the Hebrew context, what does 'dumb' most likely refer to?
options: Mute or speechless due to physical or spiritual causes
questions.correctAnswer: Mute or speechless due to physical or spiritual causes
questions.explanation: The word 'dumb' in Isaiah 35:6 refers to those who are mute or unable to speak, symbolizing restoration of voice and praise.

questions.question: Isaiah 35:5-6 describes multiple miraculous healings. This cluster of miracles is commonly seen as a foreshadowing of which Messianic prophecy?
options: The servant’s mission to heal and restore in Isaiah 61
questions.correctAnswer: The servant’s mission to heal and restore in Isaiah 61
questions.explanation: The healing miracles in Isaiah 35:5-6 align with Isaiah 61’s prophecy about the servant bringing good news, healing the brokenhearted, and proclaiming liberty.

theological.title: Isaiah Chapter 35 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Isaiah Chapter 35 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What transformation does Isaiah 35 describe occurring in the wilderness and desert?
options: They shall become glad and blossom as the rose
They shall become barren and desolate
They shall flood and become seas
questions.correctAnswer: They shall become glad and blossom as the rose
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:1 declares that the wilderness and desert will rejoice and blossom abundantly, symbolizing restoration and renewal. This theme is echoed in Psalms 72:16, Ezekiel 36:35, Matthew 3:3, and Revelation 21:1 where desolation is turned into flourishing.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 35, what is the source of the wilderness's rejoicing and blossoming?
options: The glory of the LORD and the excellency of our God
The coming of the harvest season
questions.correctAnswer: The glory of the LORD and the excellency of our God
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:2 attributes the abundant blossoming and joy to seeing the glory of the LORD and the excellency of God. This highlights God's active role in restoration, consistent with Exodus 33:18-19, Habakkuk 2:14, John 1:14, and 2 Corinthians 4:6.

questions.question: What exhortation is given to those who are weak and feeble in Isaiah 35?
options: Strengthen the weak hands and confirm feeble knees
questions.correctAnswer: Strengthen the weak hands and confirm feeble knees
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:3 calls believers to encourage and strengthen those who are weak, symbolizing God’s care for the vulnerable. This corresponds with Hebrews 12:12, Galatians 6:2, 1 Thessalonians 5:14, and James 5:16 emphasizing mutual support in the body of Christ.

questions.question: What is the message to those with a fearful heart in Isaiah 35?
options: Be strong and fear not, for God will come to save you
questions.correctAnswer: Be strong and fear not, for God will come to save you
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:4 encourages those who fear by assuring them of God’s coming vengeance and salvation. This theme of God as a deliverer is echoed in Psalm 27:1, Isaiah 41:10, John 14:27, and Romans 8:31.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 35, what miraculous healing will occur when God comes?
options: The eyes of the blind shall be opened and ears of the deaf unstopped
Only the lame shall be healed
questions.correctAnswer: The eyes of the blind shall be opened and ears of the deaf unstopped
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:5 promises physical restoration as a sign of God's salvation. This mirrors messianic prophecies in Isaiah 29:18, Matthew 11:5, Luke 7:22, and Acts 3:7-8 demonstrating Jesus’ fulfillment of these healings.

questions.question: What does Isaiah 35 say will happen to the lame and the dumb?
options: The lame will leap like a hart and the tongue of the dumb will sing
The lame will remain lame and the dumb silent
The lame will walk slowly and the dumb will whisper
The lame will crawl and the dumb will shout
questions.correctAnswer: The lame will leap like a hart and the tongue of the dumb will sing
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:6 describes exuberant healing and joy, symbolizing full restoration. This is consistent with Psalm 146:8, Luke 13:11-13, John 9:25-26, and Revelation 7:17 where God transforms infirmity into vitality and praise.

questions.question: What natural transformation is described in the wilderness and desert in Isaiah 35?
options: Waters will break out and streams will flow, turning parched ground into pools
The desert will become dry and dusty
Rivers will dry up and mountains crumble
questions.correctAnswer: Waters will break out and streams will flow, turning parched ground into pools
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:6-7 speaks of abundant water transforming dry places, symbolizing life and blessing. This imagery aligns with Isaiah 41:18, Ezekiel 47:1-12, John 4:14, and Revelation 22:1-2 concerning the life-giving provision of God’s Spirit.

questions.question: What is 'The way of holiness' mentioned in Isaiah 35?
options: A highway where the unclean shall not pass, and fools will not err
A narrow path only for the wise
A hidden trail known to few
questions.correctAnswer: A highway where the unclean shall not pass, and fools will not err
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:8 describes a sanctified path reserved for the redeemed, emphasizing purity and guidance. This concept parallels Psalm 119:105, Proverbs 4:18, John 14:6, and Hebrews 12:14 emphasizing holiness and divine guidance.

questions.question: Who is excluded from traveling on 'The way of holiness'?
questions.correctAnswer: The unclean
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:8 states that the unclean shall not pass over the way of holiness, highlighting God's holiness as a barrier to sinfulness. This is supported by Leviticus 11:44, 1 Peter 1:16, 2 Corinthians 6:17, and Revelation 21:27 emphasizing separation from impurity.

questions.question: What animals are said to be absent from the highway in Isaiah 35?
options: No lion or ravenous beast shall be there
Lions and wolves will roam freely
Bears and serpents will be present
All wild animals inhabit the highway
questions.correctAnswer: No lion or ravenous beast shall be there
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:9 assures safety on the holy way by the absence of dangerous animals, symbolizing God's protection. This echoes Psalm 91:13, Isaiah 11:6-9, Romans 8:37-39, and Revelation 7:16 where God's people are protected from harm.

questions.question: Who walks on the highway mentioned in Isaiah 35?
questions.correctAnswer: The redeemed
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:9 states that the redeemed walk on this highway, highlighting God’s salvation and the restored people. This is consistent with Exodus 14:30, Psalm 34:22, John 10:27, and Romans 8:30 describing those saved by God’s grace.

questions.question: What is the emotional state of the ransomed of the LORD upon their return to Zion in Isaiah 35?
options: They come with songs and everlasting joy upon their heads
They return in silence and sorrow
They return with anger and bitterness
questions.correctAnswer: They come with songs and everlasting joy upon their heads
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:10 highlights joyful restoration of God’s people, symbolizing eternal salvation. This joy is affirmed in Psalm 126:5, Isaiah 61:3, Luke 15:7, and Revelation 21:4 where God’s people experience everlasting joy.

questions.question: What happens to sorrow and sighing for those who are ransomed, according to Isaiah 35?
options: They shall be forgotten but return
questions.correctAnswer: They shall flee away
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35:10 promises that sorrow and sighing will flee away for God's redeemed, signifying complete restoration. This is consistent with Revelation 21:4, Psalm 30:5, John 16:20, and Romans 8:18 on the final removal of suffering.

questions.question: What attribute of God is primarily revealed in Isaiah 35 regarding the coming salvation?
options: God as a Redeemer who saves and restores
questions.correctAnswer: God as a Redeemer who saves and restores
questions.explanation: Throughout Isaiah 35, God is portrayed as the Redeemer who brings salvation, healing, and joy. This aligns with Exodus 6:6, Isaiah 43:14, Luke 4:18-19, and Titus 2:14 where God actively rescues His people.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 35 contribute to the biblical understanding of eschatology?
options: It depicts the future renewal and restoration of creation and God's people
It predicts the end of the world without restoration
It denies any future hope after death
It focuses exclusively on present judgment
questions.correctAnswer: It depicts the future renewal and restoration of creation and God's people
questions.explanation: Isaiah 35 envisions a future time when God restores the wilderness and redeems His people, a key eschatological theme. This is reflected in Isaiah 65:17, Romans 8:19-22, Revelation 21:1-5, and 2 Peter 3:13 about new creation and eternal joy.
